shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝrsanat, Homiliary (fols. 2r-165vb) I-1) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Nativity of Jesus (fols. 2ra-7ra) I-2) Homily by Theophilus of Constantinople on St. Stephen the Protomartyr (fols. 7ra-10va, fol. 13) I-3) Homily [by John Chrysostom] on Passion of Our Lord (fols. 10va-12v, 14ra-va) I-4) Homily by Ephrem on fasting, repentance and prayer (fols. 14va-15ra), possibly incomplete I-5) Homily by anonymous author (“one of the holy fathers”) on the man who was born blind (fols. 15ra-22ra), incomplete I-6) Homily by Ephrem on Passion of Our Lord and on the thief on the right hand (fols. 22ra-25vb) I-7) Homily by Jacob of Serug on the angel and the thief (fols. 25vb-32ra) I-8) Homily by Ephrem on Palm Sunday (i) (fols. 32ra-35rb) I-9) Homily by Ephrem on Palm Sunday (ii) (fols. 35rb- 39va) I-10) Homily by John Chrysostom on Palm Sunday (fols. 39va-43vb) I-11) Homily by Ephrem on Satan and death (fols. 44ra-51rb) I-12) Homily by Anǝsṭasyo [sic] of Däbrä Sina on the burial of Our Lord (fols. 51rb-64rb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 19), possibly incomplete I-13) Homily by the Orthodox on the holy spiritual Easter (fols. 65va-69vb) I-14) Homily by John Chrysostom on Easter Sunday (fols. 69vb-73va) I-15) Homily by John Theologus (Tewologos) on Easter Sunday (fols. 73va-81vb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 22) I-16) Homily by Jacob of Serug on the Apostle Thomas (fols. 82ra-87ra) I-17) Homily by John Chrysostom on Lazarus (fols. 87ra-89va) I-18) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Samaritan woman (fols. 89va-91vb) I-19) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Baptism of Our Lord (i) (fol. 92ra-94va) I-20) Homily by John Chrysostom on the wedding feast at Cana (fols. 94va-98va) I-21) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Baptism of Our Lord (ii) (fols. 98ra-100va) I-22) Homily by John Chrysostom on the sinful women who anointed the feet of Our Lord with ointment (fols. 100va-111ra) I-23) Homily by Jacob of Serug on Simeon the priest who received Jesus in the temple (fols. 111ra-117rb) I-24) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Pharisee and the publican (fols. 117rb-120vb) I-25) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Apostle Thomas (fols. 121ra-124ra) I-26) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Ten Virgins (fols. 124ra-130rb) I-27) Homily by Anǝsṭasyos of Däbrä Sina on the Transfiguration (fols. 130rb-135vb) I-28) Homily by Jacob [of Serug] on the Annunciation to Zacharias of the birth of John the Baptist (fols. 135vb-138ra) I-29) Homily [by John Chrysostom] on repentance (fols. 138ra-143rb) I-30) The Story of John of Rome who acquired the “Golden Gospel” (fols. 143rb-165vb)
Additiones 1-5.

copyists.copyist: The same scribe wrote Mss. MY-001 and MY-008.

donors.donor: According to Additio 6, the book was donated by ʿaqabe säʿat Täsäbkä Mädḫǝn, in the time of King Dawit II (r. ca. 1382-1412). His father is Hallo ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer, and his mother is ʾAsmǝʿu.

dcomments.dcomment: According to Additio 6, the Ms. was donated in the time of King Dawit II (r. ca. 1382-1412), mäkʷännǝn Aron, and maʾkäl baḥr Zä-ʾAmanuʾel. Fol. 1 originates from an older (pre-1350?) Four Gospels book.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has been rebound; the threads of the sewing are broken; the original sewing is missing. The original order of the fols. is disturbed; the parts of the manuscript were probably put together in wrong order (perhaps as the result of repair). Fol. 126 should be between fols. 144 and 145. Many fols. are held together by stitch repairs, someitimes so tightly that the structure of the quires cannot be discerned.

mslits.mslit: - D.Nosnitsin, “The Manuscript Collection of Däbrä Ma‘so Qeddus Yohannes (Tigray, Ethiopia): a First Assessment”, Comparative Oriental Manuscript Studies Newsletter No. 1, January 2011, 24-27. - D. Nosnitsin - M. Bulakh, "A Fragment of an Ancient Four Gospels Book (Lk 6:35–7:7): A Short Analysis", in: A. Bausi - A. Gori - G. Lusini (eds.), Linguistic, Oriental and Ethiopian Studies in Memory of Paolo Marrassini, Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz 2014, 551-581. - M. Bulakh, "Ancient Ge'ez Orthography: Evaluation of the Fragment of Luke (Verses 6:37–6:43) in the Manuscript MY-002 from Däbrä Ma'so, Tegray", in: A. Bausi - A. Gori - G. Lusini (eds.), Linguistic, Oriental and Ethiopian Studies in Memory of Paolo Marrassini, Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz 2014, 177-212.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Most of the quires are reinforced by parchment guards.

txfolios.txfolio: One leaf between fols. 148 and 149 is not numbered; the image has been given number 148a

squires.squire:
I(9; s.l.: {1}, no stub; 3, no stub; 5, no stub; fols. 1r-7v) – II(8/ fols. 8r-16v) – III(10/ fols. 17r-26v) – IV(8/ fols. 27r-36v) – V(8/ fols. 37r-44v) – VI(13/ fols. 45r-57v) – VII(11/ fols. 58r-68v) – VIII(13/ fols. 69v-81v) – IX(10/ fols. 82r-91v) – X(12/ fols. 92r-103v) – XI(11/ fols. 104r-114v) – XII(11/ fols. 115v-124v) – XIII(13/ fols. 125r-137v) – XIV(12/ fols. 138r-148v).
The structure of the quires is hardly discernible because of the condition of the Ms.

taunit.mr-info: All data for fol. 4r (inner margin for fol. 9r)
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible (partly round, mostly slits). The upper line is written below the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Number 6 looks like "compressed" number 7 (s. fol. 22ra, in the upper margin). Numbers are writen without the dashes above and below: s. fols. 22ra, 44ra, 100vb, 111ra, 138ra etc.

pcruxansatas.pcruxansata: Crux ansata, mounted on coronis-sign, stands at the incipit of each homily

rubrications.rubrication: Incipits of the homilies (a few lines until Text I-4, and occasionally thereafter, e.g., Text I-22; otherwise mostly three rubricated lines alterating with black lines); notes in the upper margin of the fols. indicating occasions for the reading; elements of the punctuation signs, throughout until Text I-4, and with interruptions thereafter; elements of the text dividers thereafter throughout the Ms.

otherdetails.otherdetail: The collection of homilies contained in the Ms. is similar to that in Mss. Orient 744 (WrBriMus no. cccxl), Tanasee 131 = Daga Estifanos 20 (SixTana III, 126-32), Orient. Fol. 3075 (HamSixBerl no. 161, 296-301). The sequence of the homilies is different.

additional.det: Written in the hand of the 17th-cent. Zäbanä Krǝstos (cp. Ms. MY-008).

additional.add: Fol. 147ra: አንፍጽ ። ለሙሴ፡ ነቢይ፡ በበሕር፡ ረደኢሁ፡ ይእዜኒ፡ ርድአነ፡ ከማሁ። በ፫ዘወርቅ፡ ለህም። ስብኮ፡ አመ፡ ገብረ፡ አሮን፡ ዘምሐኮ፡ መኀበርነ፡ ዮምባርኮ። በ፫መድኀኔ፡ ሕዝብ፡ በግብጽ፡ እምግብረ፡ ግንፋል፡ እምነደእት፡ ሶበ፡ ግዕሩ፡ እስረኤል፡ ምህለነ፡ ፈደ፫በሣህል። በ፫አመሐሙ፡ ሕዝብ፡ ሰአልዶ፡ ብርዕ፡ ግንፋለ፡ ወጥብዓተ፡ በገቢር፡ መድኀኒሆሙ፡ ኀብአነ፡ እምነከር። በ፫በቀለ፡ መጥቅዕ፡ ሰማዐ፡ መዋኢ፡ ለኢያሱ። ምህለነ፡ ዘይም፡ ኣንሶሰው።። [fol. 47rb] ፫ለናአድ፡ መሰፍን፡ ረደኢሁ፡ አመ፡  ኤግሎም፡ ምህለነ፡ ቀድሰ፡ ዘዮም። በ፫በረቦራ፡ ሕብር፡ ውእቱ፡ አመ፡ ሲሰራ፡ ረዲኢሃ፡ ለበ[ያ]፡ ምህለነ፡ ዘዮም፡ ሰመራ፨ በ፫ለጌድዮን፡ ጸባኢ፡ በቃለ፡ ቀርን፡ ኣድኀነነ፡ ይእዜ፡ እምዕልዋን፡ በ፫፳አህጉር ፡ ጸበኤ ።
additional.det: Written in an old hand, but different from that of the main text, with many mistakes or orthographical deviations, hardly understandable. The beginning is missing, the end has been washed out.

additional.cont: Fol. 147v: Mälkəˀa Maryam "Image of Mary", incomplete.
Fol. 147ra: Short record concerning tributes for Däbrä Maˁṣo Yoḥannәs.
additional.det: Written in an old, very crude hand, hardly understandable. Some words have been washed out.

additional.add: Fol. 148v: በአኰቴተ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዘወሀብኩ፡ ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ አነ፡ ዓቀቤ፡ ሰዐት፡ ተሰብከ፡ መድኅን፡ ለደብረ፡ ማዕጾ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ ዘወሃብኩ፡ አፈወርቅ፡ ወጳው[ሎ]ስ፡ ወማዐጠንት፡ ወወሱተይ። ሶበ፡ ተለቀሕኩ፡ ግምዛሁ፡ ለዮሓንስ፡ ፉሎተ፡ ብእሲትየ፡ ዘፈደይኩ፡ አነ፡ ተሰብከ፡ መድኅን፡ ነሥየ፡ እዘ፡ ዐቃቤ፡ ሰዓት፡ ወሥዩምሂ፡ አቡሁ፡ ሀሎ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወበዓልቴቱሂ፡ አስምዑ፡ ወንጉሥሂ፡ ዳዊት፡ ወልደ፡ ሴፋርዓድ፡ ወመኰንንሂ፡ አሮኒምስ፡ ወማእከል፡ በሕርሂ፡ ዘአማኑኤል፡ ዘሄደ፡ ወዘተአገለ፡ ዘሤጠ፡ ወዘ፡ ተሠየጠ፡ ዘለቀሐ፡ ወዘተለቀሐ፡ ለዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ይኩን፡ እመሂ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ወእመሂ፡ ሥዩም፡ ወእመሂ፡ ዘኮነ፡ ከዊኖ፡ በአፈ፡ ዐሠርቱ፡ ወኀምስቱ፡ ነቢያት፡ ወበአፈ፡ ዓሠርቱ፡ ወክልኤቱ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ወበአፈ፡ ሰብዓ፡ ወክልኤቱ፡ አርድእት፡ ወበአፈ፡ ሠለስቱ፡ ምእት፡ ዓሠርቱ፡ ወሰማንቱ፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ በአፈ፡ አብ፡ ወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወበአፉሀ፡ ለእግዚእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ ወለእመ፡ ቦዘሐከከ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ይኩን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።
additional.tran: Fol. 148v: In praise of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. The one who donated this book is I, ˁaqabe säˁat Täsäbkä Mädḫən. To Yoḥannəs, to Däbrä Maˁṣo what I donated is Chrisostomos and Paul (?) and censers and wäsutäy. When I borrowed the treasures (gəmza) of Yoḥannəs, I paid back with falot (?) of my wife, having taken (it), while I, Täsäbkä Mädḫən, am the ˁaqabe säˁat; and the śəyyum is his father Hallo ˀƎgziˀabəḥer, and his wife is ˀAsməˁu, and the king is Dawit a son of Sefarˁad, and mäkʷännən is ˀAron, and maˀkäl baḥr is Zä-ˀAmanuˀel. Anyone who plundered and robbed, who sold and bought, who lent and who borrowed this book shall be cursed, be it a priest or a śəyyum, be it who it may be, by the mouth of fifteen prophets and by the mouth of twelve apostles and by the mouth of seventy two disciples and by the mouth of three hundred eighteen orthodox (fathers), by the mouth of Father and Son and Holy Spirit and by the mouth of our Lady Mary shall be cursed, and if someone scrapes (it), shall be cursed for ever and ever. Amen.

extras.extra: - Fol. 1r-v: Luke 6:36-7:7, a fragment of an old (pre-1350) Four Gospels manuscript. - Crude writing excercises (?): fols. 2v-3r, 24r - Very crude writing exercises or pen trials, in old hands: fol. 142v, fol. 146v: ወጥን፡ በሰናይ፡ ፈጽም፡ በጽድ[ቅ]; fol. 149r (in red ink). - Crude writing exercise and attempt at drawing an ornamental band: fol. 149v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid:
- Notes in the upper margins of some fols. indicating readings for feasts and other and occasions, (written in red, in the main hand): በጌና፡ ዕለት፡: fol. 2r በዕለተ፡ እስጢፋኖስ፡: fol. 7ra በንቅዎተ፡ ዶርሆ፡: fol. 10vb በድራረ፡ ጾም፡ ምንባብ፡: fol. 14va በሣልስ፡ ሰንበተ፡ ጾም፡ ምንባብ፡: fol. 15ra በ፯፡ ሰዓት፡: fol. 122ra በዓርብ፡ ቅለት፡: fol. 25vb (in black, in a different, crude hand); the original indication is unreadable (possibly erased) በቀዳሚ፡ ሰንበተ[፡ ሆሳ]ዕና፡: fol. 35rb በዕለተ፡ ሰንበት፡ ሆሳዕና፡: fol. 39va በዓርብ፡ በ፪፡ ሰዓት፡ ዘይትነበብ፡ በዓርብ፡ ሶበ፡ የዓርብ፡ ፀሐይ፡: fol. 51ra በዕለተ፡ በዓለ፡ ፋሲካ፡: fol. 69vb በሰኑየ፡ ፋሲካ፡: fol. 73va <...> ፋሲካ፡: fol. 82ra በረቡዓ፡ ፋሲካ፡: fol. 87ra በሐሙስ፡ ፋሲካ፡: fol. 89va አመ፡ ፮ለየካቲት፡ በማርም፡ እንተ፡ ዕፍረት፡: fol. 100vb በስመዖን፡ እም፰ [sic] ለየካቲት፡: fol. 111ra በዓርበ፡ ፋሲካ፡: fol. 117rb በ፰፡ ፋሲካ፡: fol. 121ra በደናግል፡: fol. 124ra አመ [l.n.] ፫፡ ለነሐሲ [sic] ዕርገተ፡ ደብረ፡ ታቦር፡: fol. 130rb በዘካርስ፡: fol. 135vb አመ፡ ፲፪ ለግንቦት፡: fol. 138ra
In a recent hand, in pen: ሰንበት፡ ትንሳኤ፡: fol. 65va ዘስሉስ፡ ፋሲካ፡: fol. 82ra (possibly replacing the old indication, of which only the second word is readable) ዘጥምቀት፡ (possibly replacing the erased old note): fol. 92ra ቃና፡ ዘገሊላ፡: fol. 94va ዘዳግማይ፡ ትንሳኤ፡: fol. 98ra (blotted out)
